In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution for your problem using Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are the year and month of each date in the original `dt` column combined into an integer format "yyyymm".

Here is how you can use this function:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[]) # create a dataframe with dt column
push!(df, (DateTime("2021-03-01"),)) # add some dates to the df
add_yearmonth(df) # call the function
```

After running this code, you will see that `df` now has an additional column `ym` with values like "202103" for the date "2021-03-01".
